page.title: 09 A BUTTERLEIGH FARM
page.content: West Pitt Farm is 2.5 kilometres from the village of Butterleigh itself. It is not a specialist farm.They have 500 sheep(of which 220 are breeding ewes),50 friesians,30 heifers and 100 beef animals.When the sheep are ill Mr and Mrs Spencer,the owners of the farm and their farm-worker William treat them themselves. Otherwise they go to their local vet in Tiverton.They have 200 acres which are mostly on slopes.This is a problem especially in Winter.(Lorries also have difficulty driving down the lanes to collect the milk). They grow no crops except grass for silage and hay for their animals.They don't go to market very often except to buy a ram and when they do they go to {Exeter }or { {Taunton.
